gcast_end: Broadcasted the message to {0} groups and {1} users.
help_menu: Click the buttons below to get information about my commands. Note: All commands can be used with /
help_admins: Admin commands: /pause: Puase the ongoing stream. /resume: Resume the paused stream. /skip: Skip the current stream. /stop: Stop the ongoing stream. /seek [duration in seconds]: Seek the ongoing stream. /seekback [duration in seconds]: Seek the ongoing stream backward. /reload: Reloads the admin cache.
help_auth: Auth commands: Authorized users can control the ongoing stream without being an admin. /auth: Add a user to the authorized users list. /unauth: Remove a user from the authorized users list.
help_blist: Blacklist commands: Blacklisted chats and users cannot use the bot. /blacklist [chat_id|user_id]: Add a chat/user to the blacklist. /unblacklist [chat_id|user_id]: Remove a chat/user from the blacklist
help_lang: Language commands: This bot supports multiple languages. /lang: Change the language of the bot.
help_ping: Ping commands: /help: Shows the help menu of the bot. /ping: Check the ping and memory usage of the bot. /start: Start the bot. /sudolist: Shows the list of sudo users of the bot.
help_play: Play commands: You can play music in the video chat using the following commands. /play [song name/youtube url/reply to audio]: Play music in the video chat. /vplay [song name/youtube url/reply to video]: Play music video in the video chat. -f: Force play music in the video chat. -v: Plays music video in the video chat. Example: /play -f -v attention
help_queue: Queue commands: /queue: Shows the currently queued tracks in the queue.
help_sudo: Sudo commands: /ac: Shows the active calls count. /activevc: Shows the list of the active calls. /broadcast [reply to message]: Broadcasts the message to all the chats. -nochat: Excludes groups from the broadcast. -user: Include users in the broadcast. -copy: Removes the forwarded tag from the broadcast message. Example: /broadcast -user -copy /eval: Executes the given code. /logs: Sends the log file. /logger [on|off]: Enables/disables the logger. /restart: Restarts the bot. /addsudo: Add a user to the sudo users list. /rmsudo: Remove a user from the sudo users list.
